translated: having controlled the vital airs unwaveringly,🔽having ended with the sound Phaṭ, along with that very exhalation,

analyzed: tena eva dvādaśānta stha śivena saha yojayet

analyzed: vyāpya vyavasthitāni iti matvā tāni viśodhayet

analyzed: dhyātvā kuṇḍalinīm śaktim amṛta eka svarūpiṇīm

analyzed: karanyāsaḥ samākhyātaḥ aṅganyāsaḥ ca kathyate

analyzed: prayojayet imām mudrām devatā āhvāna karmaṇi

analyzed: śuddhayaḥ pañca coditāḥ

analyzed: viśuddhiḥ kathitā pūrvam āsanam ca adhunā ucyate

analyzed: adharma pramukha anante chadane padma karṇike
translated: Ananta in the covering at the end of Dharma, in the lotus pericarp,

analyzed: vāma ādi nava sūrya ādi maṇḍalam sa īśvaram yajet  /

analyzed: śiva āsanam tad ante ca yajet sva svam anusmaran

analyzed: pañca āsana ātmakam hi etat eka āsana mudīritam

analyzed: ananta ādhāra śaktibhyām bhavet anantam āsanam

analyzed: dharmāḥ dharma ādibhiḥ vargaiḥ chadanābhyām samanvitaiḥ
translated: This lion seat is said to be endowed with Dharma and other groups, along with the two coverings.

analyzed: siṃhāsanam idam proktam yogam māyā abjam ucyate

analyzed: snāna āvāhana kāla ādau pṛthak etān prakalpayet

analyzed: saṃkalpya āsanam evam tu mūrtim tad upari nyaset
translated: Having thus resolved the seat, the form should be placed upon it.

analyzed: tasmin brahmāṇi vinyasya ca aṣṭatriṃśat kalām nyaset
translated: Having placed the Brahmas in that, the thirty-eight parts should be placed.

analyzed: aṣṭatriṃśat kalā upetam pañca brahmaṇi vinyaset

analyzed: vidyā deham tatas nyastvā śivam āvāhayet tatas
translated: Then having placed the body of knowledge, Shiva should be invoked.

analyzed: sva sva sthāne hṛd ādīni vinyaset ānupūrvakam

analyzed: śivam tad upari nyasya tad ekīkaraṇam nayet

analyzed: catvāriṃśat ca vyūham syāt pṛthak syāt pañcaviṃśatiḥ
translated: There should be forty, and separately twenty-five.

analyzed: eka dvi tri caturbhiḥ tu padaiḥ vyūha antaram smṛtam

analyzed: madhya vyūhasya paritas catuṣkuṇḍantu vāṣṭakam

analyzed: sva sva saṃkhyā sama vyūhe homa artham parikalpayet

analyzed: antar mārgam samāvāhya vīthiḥ śāstre samīritam

analyzed: śivavyūhasya paritas ṣoḍaśa eva parityajet

analyzed: sūtra nyāsaḥ samākhyātaḥ anyathā api nigadyate

analyzed: sūtra dvayam nyaset pūrva apara gam yāmya saumya saumya gam
translated: Two threads should be laid from east to west and from south to north.

analyzed: sārdha hasta antaram hasta māna antaram atha api vā

original: syāccaturdaśa saṃkhyātā vīthi bāhye krameṇa ca /
analyzed: syāt caturdaśa saṃkhyātāḥ bāhye krameṇa ca
translated: There will be fourteen Vithis outside in order.

analyzed: tad bahis homam iṣṭam syāt catur dikṣu aṣṭa dikṣu vā
translated: Outside that, Homa should be performed in the four directions or eight directions.
In the fifth chapter, the procedure for daily procession

analyzed: nitya utsava vidhim vakṣye nitya pūjā aṃgam uttamam
translated: I will describe the procedure for daily procession, the excellent limb of daily worship.

analyzed: śiva agre vā atha tad vāme vāme śuddha mahī tale

analyzed: prāsāda maṇṭa pādau vā gomayena upalepite
translated: On the temple or pavilion smeared with cow dung,

analyzed: prokṣita istreṇa saṃsthāpya pātram lakṣaṇa saṃyutam
translated: Having consecrated the vessel endowed with characteristics with the weapon mantra,

analyzed: sauvarṇam rājatam tāmram kāṃsya nirmitam eva vā
translated: Made of gold, silver, copper or brass,

analyzed: tithi aṃgulam samārabhya vyoma aṃgula vivṛddhitaḥ
translated: Starting from five finger breadths and increasing by five finger breadths,

analyzed: dvātriṃśat aṃgula antam tu pātra mānam udīritam

analyzed: vṛttam iṣṭa ghana upetam karṇikā dala śobhitam

analyzed: tad pātre rasa sapta aṣṭa nava diś rudra bhājite

analyzed: eka dvi tri catur pañca ṣaṣ bhāgaiḥ karṇikā bhavet
translated: the pericarp should be one, two, three, four, five, or six parts.

analyzed: śeṣeṇa dalam ākhyātam vikārāṣṭadalam matam
translated: The remaining is said to be the petals, and the eight petals are considered to be modifications.

analyzed: ardhatri pāda mātram vā dvi mātram karṇikā ucchrayam
translated: The height of the pericarp should be half, three-fourths, or two measures.

analyzed: tadvat oṣṭa samopetam kevalam pātram eva vā
translated: Similarly, it should have eight parts, or it can be just a vessel.

analyzed: kuḍupa dvayam ārabhya kuḍupa ādāḍhaka avadhi  taṇḍulam kalpayet anna liṃga artham vā akṣata arthakam
translated: Starting from two kuḍus, up to one and a half kuḍus,🔽one should prepare rice for the purpose of the rice linga, or for the sake of unbroken rice.

analyzed: madhu ājya miśritam vā annam prakṣipet pātra madhyame
translated: Or one should put rice mixed with honey and ghee in the middle of the vessel.

analyzed: tena anna liṃgam kartavyam bhūtamātra pramāṇataḥ  eka aṃgulam tu dairghyam syāt yāvat aṣṭādaśa aṃgulam
translated: With that, the rice linga should be made, according to the measure of the elements.🔽Its length should be one finger, up to eighteen fingers.

analyzed: aṃgula trayam ārabhya tithi mātram tu vistaram
translated: Starting from three fingers, the width should be the measure of the lunar day.

analyzed: agra dvi tri catur pañca mātram ṣaṣ mātram eva vā

analyzed: naimittika artha nitya artham anna liṃgam udāhṛtam
translated: The rice linga is said to be for occasional purposes and for daily purposes.

analyzed: tri kālam anna liṃgam vā prātar madhyāhnayoḥ tu vā

analyzed: madhyāhne vā atha pūrvāhne puṣpaliṃgam udāhṛtam
translated: Or at midday or in the forenoon, the flower-linga is mentioned.

analyzed: pradoṣa ikṣata liṃgam syāt tatra pāśupatam yajet

analyzed: candraśekhara saṃyuktam tat vihīnakam eva hi
translated: Endowed with the moon crest or without it.

analyzed: tridhā pāśupataḥ jñeyaḥ miśraḥ śānta ugra hetukaḥ
translated: The Pasupata is to be known as threefold: mixed, peaceful, and without cause.

analyzed: saumyaḥ saumya īkṣaṇa apetaḥ dvi catur hasta saṃyutaḥ
translated: Gentle, devoid of gentle glances, having two or four arms.🔽Resembling a garland of lightning, white, adorned with matted hair and a crown.

analyzed: dakṣa ibhaya akṣamālā yuj itare vara pāśa yuj  /
translated: In the right hand, the abhaya mudra and rosary, in the other, the boon and noose.

analyzed: vara da abhaya pāṇiḥ vā sarva lakṣaṇa saṃyutaḥ
translated: Or with the boon-granting and abhaya mudras, endowed with all characteristics.

original: hitvā'kṣamālāṃ pāśañca padmaṃ ghaṇṭāṃ krameṇa vā // / //🔽yojayetsaumyamūrtisyādugramūrtirathocyate /
analyzed: hitvā akṣamālām pāśam ca padmam ghaṇṭām krameṇa vā  yojayet saumya mūrtiḥ syāt ugra mūrtiḥ atha ucyate
translated: Abandoning the rosary and noose, or the lotus and bell in order,🔽One should employ it. The gentle form is described. Now the fierce form is described.

analyzed: śūla mūla abhaye dakṣe

analyzed: raudra dṛṣṭim jvalat keśam vyatyāsa kara śūlakam
translated: With a fierce glance, blazing hair, and a trident with an inverted karnikara flower,

analyzed: triśūla akṣa karam vā api tridhā raudram smaran yajet
translated: Or with the trident and akshamala in the hands, one should remember the fierce form in three ways and worship.

original: evaṃ raudrantu miśraṃ syāt paraśuṃ śūlamāvaham /
analyzed: evam miśram syāt paraśum śūlam āvaham
translated: Thus, the Rudra form is mixed, with the axe and trident held in the right hand.

analyzed: dakṣe pāśam mṛgam vāme tu anyathā vā nigadyate
translated: The noose in the right hand and the deer in the left hand, or otherwise, is described.

analyzed: triśūlam abhayam savye pāśan ca vara da pradam
translated: The trident and the boon in the right hand, and the noose and the protection in the left hand,

original: dakṣa dvidhā samākhyātaṃ miśraṃ pāśupataṃ tridhā // / //
analyzed: dakṣa dvidhā samākhyātam miśram pāśupatam tridhā

analyzed: puṣpa akṣata anna liṃgeṣu
translated: In the case of food-lingas, one should worship with one's own mantra using flowers and unbroken rice.

original: athavā pratimākāro vidheyastatpramāṇataḥ // / //🔽sapīṭhe golakākāre vipīṭhe vā tamarcayet /
analyzed: athavā pratimā ākāraḥ vidheyaḥ tad pramāṇataḥ  sa pīṭhe golaka ākāre vipīṭhe vā tam arcayet

analyzed: anna liṃga pramāṇe tu mūla agra sama vistare
translated: In the case of food-lingas, the width should be equal to the length from the base to the tip.

analyzed: hasta avadhi pramāṇa ante sarva lakṣaṇa lakṣite
translated: Up to the measure of one hasta, it should be marked with all the characteristics.

analyzed: sthalikā māna daṇḍena sahitam vā samarcayet

analyzed: indu śekhara mūrtiḥ syāt pratimā lakṣaṇena tu
translated: The form of the idol should have the characteristics of the form of the moon-crested one.

analyzed: pāduke tri aṃgule tasmāt aṃgula aṃgula vardhanāt  tithi mātra avasānam tu tayoḥ dairghyam prakīrtitam
translated: The sandals should be three angulas in size, increasing by one angula each.🔽The length of the two is declared to end with the lunar days.

analyzed: dairghya anusārataḥ kāryaḥ vistārasya ardhaḥ ucchrayaḥ
translated: The height should be half the width according to the length.

analyzed: aṣṭa aṃśa avadhikaḥ madhya mānena nava mānakaḥ

analyzed: tayoḥ tu vṛṣabhaḥ pūjyaḥ tu anantaḥ vā prakīrtitaḥ
translated: Among them, the bull is worshipped, or Ananta is proclaimed.

analyzed: samantāt lokapāḥ pūjyāḥ pūjā ādau avasānake

analyzed: nava anna liṃga saṃyuktam atha nitya utsavam nayet
translated: Then one should perform the daily festival along with the nine-navel Linga.

analyzed: sarvaiḥ etaiḥ samāyukta nitya utsavam atha ācaret

original: dvābhyāṃ tribhiścaturbhiḥ vā pūrvāh ṇe ca pradoṣake // / //
analyzed: dvābhyām tribhiḥ caturbhiḥ vā pūrva ah ṇe ca pradoṣake

analyzed: āropya alaṃkṛtān devān vitānena samanvitam  chatra cāmara saṃyuktam nānā dhvaja samanvitam
translated: along with the canopy,🔽accompanied by umbrellas, chowries, various flags,

analyzed: gīta nṛtta samāyuktam vādya dhvani samanvitam  dhūpa dīpa samāyuktam pradakṣiṇam samācaret
translated: accompanied by singing, dancing, and the sound of musical instruments,🔽accompanied by incense and lamps, one should perform the circumambulation.

analyzed: ādyam pradakṣiṇam kuryāt maṃgiṇī tāla saṃyutam
translated: One should perform the first circumambulation with the Mangini tala.

analyzed: vṛṣasya brahmatālam syāt agneḥ tālam tu bhṛṃgiṇī  /

For the Mothers, it should be the Chandavada, and for Vighnaraja, it should be the Dhakki.

analyzed: ṣaṇmukhasya udghaṭan ca eva jyeṣṭhāyāḥ kuñcita tālakam

analyzed: taṭa prahāram durgāyāḥ caṇḍake viṣama cihnakam
translated: The slap on the bank of Durgā, and the uneven mark of Caṇḍikā.

analyzed: grāme vā nagare vā api tathā prākāre eva vā

analyzed: dvitīya bhramaṇam hi etat mahā pīṭha pradakṣiṇam

analyzed: paiśāce tu ekam evam syāt cabarī tāla saṃyutam

analyzed: gopure vādya hīnam vā śaṃkha dhvani samanvitam

analyzed: indrasya gāndhāra svara saṃyutam

analyzed: baddha āvaṇam bhavet agneḥ kolligāna samanvitam

analyzed: paścime nava tālam tu kāmara dhvani saṃyutam
translated: In the west, the Nava tāla, accompanied by the Kāmaradhvana sound,

analyzed: vāyavyām bali tālam tu takkeśī svara saṃyutam

analyzed: saumyāyām koṭikaḥ proktaḥ tarka rāgaḥ samanvitaḥ

analyzed: śālā pāṇi samāyuktam śāṃkare ḍhakkarī matā

analyzed: evam pradakṣiṇam kṛtvā tṛtīyam dhām saṃviśet

original: pakṣālitāṃghrayassarve praviśeyuśśivālayam // / //🔽athavā maṇṭapādau tu pīṭhasaṃsthāna mūrtiṣu /
analyzed: pakṣālita aṃghrayaḥ sarve praviśeyuḥ śiva ālayam  athavā maṇṭapādau tu pīṭha saṃsthāna mūrtiṣu

analyzed: pādya ādyaiḥ upacāraiḥ tu pūjayitvā praveśayet

analyzed: liṃgāt devam samāhṛtya liṃge dakṣe niveśayet

analyzed: śivasya pādau pūjyau pāduke vāma dakṣiṇau
translated: Shiva's feet should be worshipped, and the sandals on the left and right sides.

analyzed: anyeṣām api devānām devīnām mūla bimba vat
translated: For other gods and goddesses also, the form should be like the original image.

analyzed: rūpa antaram vā svādhyāya

analyzed: saṃpādya tena nitya ntu nitya utsavam atha ācaret
translated: Having accomplished the daily worship with that, one should then perform the daily festival.

analyzed: tat astram anna liṃga ādau pūjanīyam sva vāhanam
translated: The weapon of that deity should be worshipped in the food-linga, etc., and its vehicle.

analyzed: pādukāḥ dvitaye pūjyam anyat sarvam samānakam  /

analyzed: ṣaṣṭhe paṭale mahotsava vidhiḥ
translated: In the sixth chapter, the procedure of the great festival.

analyzed: utsavam saṃpravakṣyāmi yathāvat anupūrvakam
translated: I shall duly describe the festival in due order.

analyzed: dhvaja āroha avaroha antā kriyā utsavaḥ ucyate
translated: The rite ending with the hoisting and lowering of the flag is called the festival.

analyzed: dhvajāṃkuraḥ dhvajaṃgasyāt dhvajāt pūrvam tu tat nayet
translated: The flag should be planted before the flag-staff, and it should be taken there before the flag.

analyzed: tīrtha ṛkṣam ādau niścitya tad pūrve triguṇe api vā
translated: Having determined the sacred place and constellation at the beginning, or three times that, or

analyzed: dvigeṇe tad dine vā api dhvaja ārohaṇam ārabhet

analyzed: māsabham tīrtha nakṣatram ārdrakṣam sarva māsake
translated: The sacred place and constellation for a month is the constellation of the moon in all months.

analyzed: rājñām janma avasāna ṛkṣam ā abhiṣeka ṛkṣam eva vā
translated: For kings, it is the constellation at the time of birth, or the constellation at the time of coronation.

analyzed: māgha māse tu ṣaṣṭhī antam parva antam sarva māsake
translated: In the month of Magha, up to the sixth day, and on the parva day in all months.

analyzed: viṣuva ayana paryantam grahaṇa antam tu tīrtha bham
translated: The sacred place extends up to the equinox, up to the eclipse,

analyzed: bhūta aṣṭamī antam anyeṣām sva sva tīrtha avasānakam
translated: up to the eighth lunar day in the dark fortnight for others, ending with their own sacred place.

original: triguṇe dviguṇe vāpi taddine vāhni rātrike /
analyzed: triguṇe dviguṇe vā api tad dine vā ahni rātrike
translated: On the day of three times or two times, or on that day itself, during the day and night,

analyzed: adhivāsana pūrvam tu dhvajam āropayet guruḥ
translated: the preceptor should hoist the flag after the consecration.

analyzed: pañca hasta ādi visva antam dhvaja dairghyam prakalpayet
translated: The length of the flag should be planned from five cubits to the end of the world.

analyzed: mānam etat samākhyātam śiraḥ puccha antare dvijāḥ
translated: This is said to be the measure, O Brahmins, from the head to the end of the tail.

analyzed: tad saṃyuktam ca vā grāhyam catur sapta sama avadhi
translated: Or it can be accepted as having a length of four to seven cubits.

analyzed: bhāgam kṛtvā eka bhāgena paṭa vistāraḥ ucyate
translated: Dividing it into parts, the width of the cloth is said to be one part.

analyzed: vistāreṇa samaḥ pucchaḥ tri pādam vā ardham ucyate
translated: The tail is said to be equal to the width, three-fourths or half.

analyzed: vistāra ardham śiraḥ jñeyam puccha dvaya samanvitam
translated: The head should be known as half the width, along with two tails.

analyzed: vetra dvaya samāyuktam tad madhye vṛṣabham likhet
translated: In the middle of that, a bull should be drawn, along with two bamboo poles.

original: āyādi śubhasaṃyuktaṃ sthitaṃ vā śayanānvitam // //🔽śvetaṃ vā raktavarṇaṃ vā pītaṃ vālasamanvitam /

translated: It should be auspicious, standing or lying down.🔽White, red, or yellow, along with a tail.

analyzed: rakta śṛṃga samāyuktam tadvat khura samanvitam
translated: Equipped with red horns and hooves.

analyzed: grāma abhimukha saṃsthānam grāma ādi bhramaṇe vṛṣam
translated: The bull should be facing the village, wandering in the village and other places.

analyzed: viśvāmitra ādi ṣaṭtriṃśat mātra utsadha samanvitam
translated: Along with the thirty-six mothers beginning with Vishvamitra.

analyzed: tri varṇa nayana anvitam
translated: Endowed with the characteristics of caste and family, with three colors and eyes.

analyzed: sarva lakṣaṇa saṃyuktam svarṇa mālā samanvitam
translated: Endowed with all characteristics, along with a golden garland.

analyzed: mānam mātrā aṃgulābhyām syāt dhvaja daṇḍa paṭaḥ vṛṣaḥ
translated: The height of the bull should be two cubits. It should have a flagstaff, cloth, and a bull.

analyzed: padmāsana samāyuktam pārśve dīpa dvaya anvitam  cāmara dvaya saṃyuktam chatra saṃvṛta mastakam
translated: It should be endowed with the lotus posture, and two lamps on the sides.🔽It should be endowed with two chowries, and its head covered with an umbrella.

analyzed: pūrṇa kumbha yutam vā api triśūlena
translated: It may be accompanied by a full pot, or with a trident.

original: evaṃ vṛṣaṃ samāpādya kṛtvā vā netramokṣaṇam /
analyzed: evam vṛṣam samāpādya kṛtvā vā netra mokṣaṇam
translated: Having thus completed the bull, or having performed the eye-opening ritual,

original: astra toyena saṃprokṣya śivāgre maṇṭapepi vā // //
analyzed: astra toyena saṃprokṣya śiva agre vā
translated: Having sprinkled it with weapon water, in front of Shiva or in a pavilion,

analyzed: vā sthaṇḍila dvaya saṃyute
translated: In a delightful other place, or in a place with two altars,

analyzed: sthālikā ūrdhve nyaset pātram tripādī upari saṃsthitam
translated: On top of the vessel, one should place a pot placed on three feet.

analyzed: dhvajan nava ghaṭam vastra hema ratnam sa kūrcakam
translated: The flag, the nine-part vessel, cloth, gold, gems, and a bunch of darbha grass,

analyzed: sa apidhānam sa sūtram ca madhyame vṛṣabha adhipam
translated: With a lid and thread, in the middle, the lord of bulls,

analyzed: kalaśaiḥ aṣṭa saṃkhyātaiḥ sa apidhānaiḥ sa vastrakaiḥ
translated: Surrounded by eight numbered pots with lids and cloths,

analyzed: sa lokapaiḥ sa kūrcaiḥ tu vṛtam vṛṣabha pūrvakam
translated: With world guardians and bunches of darbha grass, along with the bull,

analyzed: ādhāra ākhyam anantam ca dharma ādyam ca catuṣṭayam
translated: Ananta known as the support, and the four beginning with Dharma,

analyzed: vṛṣa āsana padam ca uktvā caturthī antam hṛdā anvitam
translated: Having uttered the word bull-seated, ending with the fourth case and endowed with the heart,

original: praṇavādi namontañca kṛtvokṣāsanamatrahi /🔽vṛkāraṃ hṛtpuṭaṃ kṛtvā vṛṣamūrtiṃ prakalpayet // //
analyzed: praṇava ādi namaḥ ntam ca kṛtvā ukṣa āsanam atra hi           prakalpayet
translated: Having recited the Pranava (Om) at the beginning and Namah (Salutation) at the end, one should place the sacrificial ladle here.🔽Having made the syllable Vru (Vam) the heart, one should conceive the form of Vrishabha (Bull).

original: ūrdhve brahmāṇi vinyasya mūlantatkalpitanyaset /🔽saṃkalpitahṛdādīṃśca krameṇa viniveśayet // //
analyzed: ūrdhve brahmāṇi vinyasya mūlam tad kalpita nyaset  saṃkalpita hṛd ādīn ca krameṇa viniveśayet
translated: Having assigned the Brahmas (faces) above, one should perform the Nyasa (assignment) of the Mula (root).🔽One should place the Sankalpitahridaya (conceived heart) etc. in order.

analyzed: tatva tatva īśvara upetam  āvāhana ādikam pūrvam pramukham vṛṣa mūlataḥ
translated: One should perform the Nyasa of the Murti (form) and Murtisha (Lord) along with the Tatvas (principles) and Tattveshwara (Lord of principles).

analyzed: kṛtvā vṛṣabha gāyatryā gandha ādyaiḥ kramaśas urcayet
translated: Having performed the invocation etc. earlier, one should worship with the Vrishabha Gayatri (Veda mantra) and with scents etc. in order.

analyzed: madhya kumbhe pi saṃpūjya lokapān paritas yajet  /
translated: Having worshipped in the central pot, one should worship the Lokas (worlds) around.

original: vṛṣabha gāyatrī tīkṣṇaśṛṅgāya vigrahe vedapādāya dhīmahi /
analyzed: vṛṣabha gāyatrī tīkṣṇa śṛṅgāya vigrahe veda pādāya dhīmahi
translated: The Vrishabha Gayatri is: We meditate on the sharp-horned form, the four-footed one, the intelligent one.

analyzed: tat naḥ vṛṣabhaḥ pracodayāt
translated: May the bull inspire us.

original: kuṇḍe vā sthaṇḍile vāpi pūrvavatparikalpite /🔽nirīkṣaṇādi saṃskāraiśśivāgniṃ saṃprakalpayet // //
analyzed: kuṇḍe vā sthaṇḍile vā api pūrvavat parikalpite  nirīkṣaṇa ādi saṃskāraiḥ śiva agnim saṃprakalpayet
translated: In a pit or on an altar previously prepared,🔽One should establish the Shiva fire with the purificatory rites of sprinkling etc.

analyzed: tad madhye vṛṣam āvāhya sa aṃgam santarpayet tadā
translated: Having invoked the bull in its midst, one should offer libations to it along with its parts.

analyzed: sāmidājyena caruṇā śatena aṣṭa uttareṇa ca
translated: With Samid (sacrificial wood), ghee, and cooked rice, one hundred and eight times.

analyzed: tatva tatva īśvara ādīn ca homayet tad anantaram
translated: Thereafter, one should offer oblations to the Tatvas (principles) and Tattveshwara (Lord of principles) etc.

analyzed: pūrṇān datvā sa mūlena sarvakāmaprapūraṇīm
translated: Having offered full oblations with the root mantra, which fulfills all desires.

analyzed: saṃpūjya gandha puṣpa ādyaiḥ nivedayet
translated: Having worshipped with incense, flowers, etc., one should offer black gram and rice.

original: paṭasthāya ghaṭasthāya vṛṣāyāsana rūpiṇe // //🔽prātassaṃpūjya gandhādyaiḥ paṭaṃ kumbhaṃ yathākramam /
analyzed: paṭa sthāya ghaṭa sthāya vṛṣāya āsana rūpiṇe    prātar saṃpūjya gandha ādyaiḥ paṭam kumbham yathākramam
translated: To the one who resides in the cloth, to the one who resides in the pot, to the one in the form of the bull seat,🔽Having worshipped in the morning with incense, etc., the cloth and the pot in order,

analyzed: mukha vāsana tāmbūlam vṛṣabhāya nivedayet
translated: One should offer mouth perfume and betel nut to the bull.

analyzed: punar pūrṇāhutim datvā sarva maṃgala saṃyutam
translated: Again, having offered the full oblation, which is endowed with all auspicious things,

analyzed: sarva ātodya samāyukta nṛtta vādya samanvitam
translated: Along with all musical instruments, accompanied by dance and music,

original: raṃge vā śibikāyāṃ vā samāropya vṛṣadhvajam /
analyzed: raṃge vā śibikāyām vā samāropya vṛṣadhvajam
translated: Having placed the bull-bannered one either on the stage or in the palanquin,

analyzed: triśūlena samāyuktan deveśena yutan navā
translated: Endowed with the trident, united with the lord of gods,

analyzed: grāma dakṣiṇat nītvā praviśet ālayam prati
translated: Having taken him to the right of the village, one should enter the temple.

analyzed: daṇḍam saṃsthāpayet paścāt sarva lakṣaṇa saṃyutam
translated: One should then install the staff endowed with all characteristics.

analyzed: dhvaja ārohaṇa dine vā api adhivāsa dine api vā
translated: On the day of hoisting the flag or on the consecration day,

analyzed: dhāma uccaḥ tāra sadṛśaḥ dviguṇaḥ triguṇaḥ api vā
translated: The height of the temple should be equal to the height of the flagstaff, or twice or thrice that.

analyzed: ṣaṣ sapta vasu hastena
translated: With six, seven or eight cubits of the staff, it is the lowest of the three.

analyzed: eka ādi tala paryantam gopura antam atha api vā
translated: Up to eleven stories or up to the main gate,

analyzed: rudra dviguṇa madhyastha kara saṃkhyā mitam tu vā
translated: Or with the number of fingers in the middle doubled by Rudra,

analyzed: ced tu khātam ced tat bahiṣkṛtam
translated: Or the number of threads should be equal to the number of fingers multiplied by two and a half, if the middle is reduced by one.🔽If the pit is dug outside, it is excluded.

analyzed: sarvaḥ śūla ukta vṛkṣaḥ vā tvaksāra kramuka ādikaḥ
translated: Or any tree mentioned in the Shula, or a tree with bark and pith like Krmuka, etc.
The wood of Palasha, Khadira, Ashvattha, Vata, Chandana,

analyzed: sālam mādhūka tālam vā sāra āmrakam atha api vā
translated: or Shala, Madhuka, Tala, or Saramra,

original: vaiṇavaṃ jāti vṛkṣai vā śamībilvamathāpi vā // //
analyzed: vaiṇavam vā śamībilvam atha api vā
translated: or bamboo, or trees of the jati species, or Shami, Bilva,

analyzed: campakaḥ vā dvis aṣṭa ādi triguṇa avadhi nāha yuj
translated: or Champaka, with a girth of twelve, eighteen, or more, up to three times the height,

analyzed: svabhāva nāha saṃyuktaḥ tvac sāra druma ṛni mitaḥ
translated: having a natural girth, made of a tree with bark and pith,

analyzed: dhvaja daṇḍaḥ samākhyātaḥ dhvaja yaṣṭiḥ ca kathyate
translated: is said to be the flagstaff. The flag pole is also described.

analyzed: dvi bhāga ādi nava aṃśa antam daṇḍa dairghyam vidhāya ca
translated: Having determined the length of the staff from two parts to nine parts,

analyzed: eka aṃśena vidhātavyā dhvaja yaṣṭiḥ guru uttamāḥ
translated: the best teachers prescribe the flag pole to be one part in length.

analyzed: pañca aṃgulam samārabhya ca aṃgulāt ṣoḍaśa aṃgulam
translated: Starting from five finger breadths up to sixteen finger breadths,

analyzed: yāvat tāvat parīṇāham upadaṇḍasya kalpayet
translated: one should determine the girth of the lower part of the staff.

analyzed: pañca aṃśāt dvādaśa aṃśa antam mūlanāham vidhāya ca
translated: Having determined the girth of the base from five parts to twelve parts,

analyzed: eka aṃśena ūnam agram syāt tathā daṇḍa agram iṣyate
translated: the tip should be one part less, and the tip of the staff is considered thus.

analyzed: daṇḍa uktaḥ veṇu vṛkṣaḥ vā dhvaja yaṣṭi mahīruhaḥ
translated: The staff should be made of bamboo as mentioned in the Danda Sastra, or of a tree suitable for a flagstaff.

analyzed: ubhayoḥ yoga asiddhi artham skandha trayam atha āharet
translated: Then, for the accomplishment of both yogas, one should take three parts.

analyzed: skandham dvayam tad māna dvādaśa aṃgula mānataḥ
translated: The two parts should be twelve angulas long.

analyzed: ṣaṭtriṃśat mātra paryantam skandha dairghyam prakalpayet
translated: The length of the shoulder should be determined up to thirty-six matras.

original: saptāṃgulaṃ samārabhya gāyatryarṇāṃgulāvadhi // //🔽skandhavistāra uddiṣṭo mūlāṃgre tu tribhāgataḥ /
analyzed: sapta aṃgulam samārabhya gāyatrī arṇa aṅgula avadhi  skandha vistāraḥ uddiṣṭaḥ mūla aṃgre tu tri bhāgataḥ
translated: Starting from seven angulas up to the angula of the Gayatri verse,🔽The width of the shoulder is prescribed. At the tip of the root, it should be one-third.

original: ardhena vā tripādena darvyākāro yathā tathā // //
analyzed: ardhena vā tri pādena darvī ākāraḥ yathā tathā
translated: Either half or three-fourths, like the shape of a ladle.

analyzed: catur tri dvayaṃgulam vā api mānam eṣām prakīrtitam  prānte yaṣṭi agra deśake  /
translated: The measure of these is declared to be four, three, or two angulas.🔽The lower part of the shoulder should have a half-hole at the tip, in the region of the top of the staff.

analyzed: mūla agra suṣira upeta daṇḍa yaṣṭi anurūpataḥ  prānte yaṣṭi agra deśake  /
translated: Equipped with a hole at the root and tip, according to the size of the staff.🔽The lower part of the shoulder should have a half-hole at the tip, in the region of the top of the staff.

analyzed: daṇḍa prānte vidheyam syāt valayam skandhaḥ eva vā

analyzed: bṛhat skandha tri bhāga artham tri pāda guṇa mānataḥ
translated: The large shoulder should be one-third, three-fourths, or half the size.

analyzed: ṣaṣ aṃgulam samārabhya ṣaṣ aṃgula vivṛddhitaḥ
translated: Starting from six angulas, increasing by six angulas,

original: daṇḍakhātapramāṇāntandaṇdāgrā dvalaya sthitaḥ // //🔽tadardhaṃ valayādūrdhvaṃ yaṣṭyagraṃ parikīrtitam /
analyzed: sthitaḥ  tad ardham valayāt ūrdhvam yaṣṭyagram parikīrtitam

analyzed: bhū praviṣṭa pramāṇam yat daṇḍa agre yaṣṭi dairghyakam  /
translated: The length of the staff is the measure of the staff inserted into the ground.

analyzed: kalpayet mahat alpam vā khātam ced tat bahiṣkṛtam
translated: If the hole is dug outside, it should be made large or small.

translated: The ring and the shoulder should be placed up to the tip of the staff.

original: dviguṇāntaṃ vidheyaṃ vā bhūmānaṃ bhūgatadvijāḥ // //🔽ekāṃgulaṃ samārabhya pādamātravivṛddhitaḥ /

analyzed: tri mātrā antaḥ vidheyam syāt valayaḥ kīla saṃyutaḥ
translated: The ring, along with the peg, should be prescribed from one finger breadth, increasing by a quarter finger breadth, up to three finger breadths.

analyzed: valaya ākāśaḥ eṣaḥ vā valayasya ādyathā balam  rajjuḥ valaya madhye syāt jyeṣṭha ādi aṃgula nāha yuj
translated: This space in the ring should be equal to the strength of the ring.🔽The rope should be in the middle of the ring, having a thickness of the best finger breadth and so on.

analyzed: dhvaja āroha kriyā yogya dairghyeṇa ca samanvitam
translated: Endowed with the length suitable for the hoisting of the flag,

analyzed: tantu syāt aśaktau bandhanāhakam
translated: the rope should be prescribed as three times the thickness, or the thickness of the binding in case of inability.

original: evaṃ rajjuṃ samāpādya śuddhirdaṇḍe vidhāya ca /
analyzed: evam rajjum samāpādya śuddhiḥ daṇḍe vidhāya ca
translated: Having thus prepared the rope and purified the staff,

analyzed: saṃveṣṭya darbha mālābhiḥ ūrdhvāt sarvam krameṇa tu  śata darbha kṛtam kūrcam yaṣṭi agre viniveśayet
translated: Having wrapped it with garlands of darbha grass, all upwards in order.🔽One should place a cushion made of one hundred darbha blades at the top of the staff.

analyzed: astramantreṇa saṃprokṣya śiva tattva ādika nyaset
translated: Having sprinkled it with the mantra of the weapon, one should perform the nyasa of the principles of Shiva and others.

analyzed: sādhi pañca tridhā daṇḍam vibhajya agrāt krameṇa tu
translated: Having divided the staff into three parts along with the top, in order,

analyzed: skandha traye ca tāni eva valaye ravim arcayet  /
translated: In the three sections, one should worship the sun in the rings.

analyzed: rajju śaktiḥ samākhyātā śivaḥ syāt daṇḍanāyakaḥ  gandha ādyaiḥ arcayet devan tatas sthāpanam ārabhet
translated: The rope is said to be Shakti, and Shiva should be the leader of the staff.🔽One should worship the god with fragrances etc., and then commence the installation.

analyzed: ratna nyāsam tatas kuryāt daṇḍa mūle niveśayet

analyzed: kūrmam vā vṛṣabham vā api daṇḍa mūle niveśayet  /

analyzed: adhomukham ca daṣḍa adhas sva sva mantra arcitam dvijāḥ
translated: O Brahmins, having worshipped it with its own mantra, with the face downwards and the feet below,

analyzed: tad ūrdhve sthāpayet daṇḍam yaṣṭiḥ agre yathā bhavet

analyzed: devālaya ānanaḥ daṇḍaḥ vṛṣa agre vā
translated: The face of the temple should be on the top of the bull or at the back,

analyzed: tathā eva gopurasya api mahā pīṭha antike pi vā
translated: Likewise, at the entrance of the Gopura or near the great pedestal,

analyzed: antar maṇḍala sāla ādi madhya gopura madhyatas
translated: The inner courtyard, halls, etc., are in the middle of the main gate.

analyzed: nava pañca eka daṇḍaḥ vā vasu dikṣu catasṛṣu
translated: There should be nine, five, or one staff in the four directions, in the cardinal directions.

analyzed: pradhānaḥ tu agre deśa sthaḥ dhvajāḥ tad saṃkhyayā amatāḥ
translated: The main one is placed in the front, and the flags are of the same number.

original: aṣṭadikṣu ca vidyeśāścaturdikṣu narādikāḥ // / //🔽daṇḍādhipāssamākhyātā paṭeṣu vṛṣa eva hi /
analyzed: aṣṭa dikṣu ca vidyeśāḥ catur dikṣu nara ādikāḥ  paṭeṣu vṛṣaḥ eva hi
translated: In the eight directions are the lords of knowledge, and in the four directions are men and others.🔽The lords of the staff are declared, and on the cloth, it is only the bull.

analyzed: daṇḍa mūle tu kartavyā vedikā sā tu anekadhā
translated: At the base of the staff, an altar should be made, which is of many kinds.

analyzed: hasta mātram samārabhya tri aṃgula ādi vivṛddhitaḥ
translated: Beginning with one cubit, increasing by three finger breadths,

analyzed: dvi hasta māna paryantam vedikā vistaraḥ mataḥ

original: samottuṃgā tripādā vā aṣṭāṃśāt saptapañca vā /
analyzed: sama uttuṃgā tri pādā vā aṣṭa aṃśāt sapta pañca vā
translated: Equal in height, one-third, or one-eighth, seven-fifth,

analyzed: dvi tri aṃgula kṣayāt vā api mekhalā mānam īritam  /

analyzed: mekhalā rahite pīṭhe mūle syāt upavedikā
translated: On the seat without ledges, there should be a small altar at the base.

analyzed: dvai aṃgulāt pāda vṛddhayā tu ṣaṣ aṃgula samā vidhi
translated: From two finger breadths, increasing by one-fourth, up to six finger breadths, the procedure is the same.

analyzed: utsedhāḥ parikīrtitāḥ
translated: The heights are declared to be half, half, and three-fourths of the base.

analyzed: vedi ūrdhva ibjam prakartavyam catur aṃgula mānataḥ
translated: The lotus should be made above the altar, four finger-breadths in size.

analyzed: vyoma aṃgula vivṛddhyā aṣṭādaśa aṅgula sama avadhi

analyzed: padma utsedhaḥ samākhyātaḥ vistāraḥ vedikā samaḥ

analyzed: ekaika aṃgula veśāt tu

analyzed: padma veśaḥ samākhyātaḥ padmam syāt karṇikā yutam

analyzed: karṇikā nirgamaḥ daṇḍāt pāda āvṛddhayā eka mārgataḥ
translated: The emergence of the pericarp is from the staff, increasing by a quarter each, up to one path.

analyzed: guṇa aṃgula avadhiḥ kāryaḥ tat utsedhanam ucyate  / catur aṣṭa dalam padmam vikāradalam eva vā
translated: It should be made up to six finger-breadths. The height of that is declared.🔽The lotus should have four or eight petals, or petals with variations.

analyzed: vṛttam vā caturaśram vā vidheyan dala veṣṭanam
translated: The wrapping of the petals should be circular or square.

original: tathopadalasaṃyuktaṃ tadviyuktantu vā bhavet /🔽evaṃ saṃpādya pīṭhantu kārayechśilpitoṣaṇam // / //
analyzed: tathā upadala saṃyuktam tad viyuktam tu vā bhavet  evam saṃpādya pīṭham tu kārayet śilpi toṣaṇam
translated: It may be connected with the secondary petals, or not connected with them.🔽Having thus prepared the pedestal, one should have it made to please the craftsmen.

analyzed: puṇyāham vācayitvā tu astreṇa abhyukṣya vedikam
translated: Having recited the auspicious verses, having sprinkled the altar with the weapon mantra,

analyzed: darbhaiḥ daṇḍam samāveṣṭya vṛṣa kumbham ca tad paṭam
translated: having wrapped the staff with darbha grass, and the bull's testicles and cloth,

original: triśūlena samāyuktaṃ maṃgalāṃkuraśobhitam /🔽dhāmnaḥ pradakṣiṇavaśānnītvā daṇḍasya sannidhim // / //

analyzed: yāga ārambha dine vā atha tīrtha dāna dine api ca  sakalam bhrāmayet grāmam prāyaścittam na ca ucyate
translated: Or on the day of starting the sacrifice, or on the day of giving charity etc.,🔽One should take the entire village around. No expiation is stated.

analyzed: grāma pradakṣiṇe hīne diśā homam tu kārayet  /
translated: If there is a deficiency in circumambulating the village, one should perform the Homa in all directions.

analyzed: nirmale nabhasi indoḥ ca darśana vaśyam eva ca
translated: When the sky is clear and the moon is seen, it is necessary,

analyzed: bera yātrā prakartavyā balin nityam samācaret
translated: The procession of the idol should be performed. One should always do it with strength.

original: tīrthāhnaḥ pañcame pūrve caturthe vā samācaret /
analyzed: tīrtha ahnaḥ pañcame pūrve caturthe vā samācaret
translated: On the fifth day before the Tīrtha day or on the fourth day,

analyzed: taila abhyaṃgam ca tad vāre rātri cūrṇa yutam tu vā
translated: One should apply oil to the door or mix it with night powder.

analyzed: tāmbūla dāna sahitan deve bhakteṣu ca kramāt
translated: Along with the offering of betel leaves, to the deity and devotees in order,

analyzed: anyatra api ca kartavyam
translated: The left-handed rites should be performed elsewhere also, even during the hoisting of the flag.

analyzed: deva agre sthāpayet tailam
translated: The oil should be placed in front of the deity on the sacrificial ground on a mystic diagram.

original: astramantreṇa saṃprokṣya saṃhitā manunā labhet // //🔽kavacenāva kuṇṭhyātha yajedgandhādhibhiḥ hṛdā // / //🔽śivatatvādibhistailaṃ mūlayuktairnamontakaiḥ /
analyzed: astramantreṇa saṃprokṣya saṃhitāḥ manunā labhet  kavacena ava kuṇṭhyā atha yajet gandha ādhibhiḥ hṛdā  śiva tattva ādibhiḥ tailam mūla yuktaiḥ namaḥ ntakaiḥ
translated: Having sprinkled it with the mantra of the weapon, it should be obtained with the saṃhitā mantra.🔽Then, having covered it with the protective mantra, it should be worshipped with scents and the heart mantra.🔽The oil should be consecrated with the mantras of Śiva tattva etc. ending with namaḥ and prefixed with the mūla mantra.

analyzed: nikṣipet mūrdhni rātri cūrṇam anukramāt
translated: Along with flowers, the head-powder should be placed on the head in order.

original: lalāṭāt pādabāhvantaṃ devyāḥ kaṇṭhāntamācaret /🔽tatra vanyatra vā snānaṃ kṛtvā maudgannivedayet // / //
analyzed: lalāṭāt pāda bāhu antam devyāḥ kaṇṭha antam ācaret  tatra vanyatra vā snānam kṛtvā maudgan nivedayet  /
translated: From the forehead to the end of the feet and arms, it should be done up to the neck of the deity.🔽There or elsewhere, having bathed, the rice of the wild variety should be offered.

analyzed: tīrtha ahnāt pūrva divase tad pūrve vā samācaret
translated: It should be done on the day before the holy bath or on the day before that.

analyzed: naṭeśa bhramaṇam kuryāt tad ardham pūrva rātrike
translated: The circumambulation of Nāṭeśa should be done, half of that on the previous night.

analyzed: kautukam pūrva vidhinā kārayet nṛtta mūrtaye
translated: The auspicious thread should be made according to the previous procedure for the dancing form.

analyzed: sarva ābharaṇa yuktāya pūjitāya viśeṣataḥ
translated: To the one endowed with all ornaments, especially worshipped.

analyzed: tasmāt anyatra raṃge
translated: Therefore, elsewhere in a pavilion or on a stage in the assembly hall,

analyzed: sarva alaṃkāra saṃyuktam kṛtvā dhāma pradakṣiṇam
translated: having made all decorations, the circumambulation of the temple should be done.

original: tatkāle vā prabhāte vā devadevaṃ praveśya ca /🔽vinodadarśanañcāpi kārayedvijasattamāḥ // / //
analyzed: tad kāle vā prabhāte vā devadevam praveśya ca  vinoda darśanam ca api kārayet vijasattamāḥ
translated: At that time or in the morning, having brought in the Lord of gods,🔽and also the exhibition of entertainment should be made, O best of Brahmins.
Having performed the morning bath etc., one should adorn with ornaments worthy of adornment.

analyzed: nānā agaru sugandham ca karpūreṇa vimiśritam
translated: And with various fragrant aloe wood mixed with camphor.

analyzed: dhāma pradakṣiṇam kṛtvā sarva ātodya samanvitam
translated: Having circumambulated the temple, along with all musical instruments.

analyzed: sthaṇḍila upari saṃsthāpya puṇyāham vācayet tatas
translated: Having placed on the sacrificial ground, one should then recite the auspicious benediction.

analyzed: saṃprokṣya arghya ambhasā astreṇa mantrayet śarva śambaraiḥ
translated: Having sprinkled with the water of worship and the weapon, one should consecrate with the mantras of Sarva and Shambara.

analyzed: gandha ādibhiḥ samabhyarcya kavacena avakuṇṭhayet  samidh ājyena caruṇā tila lāja gulaiḥ tu vā
translated: Having worshipped with scents etc., one should seal with the protective mantra.🔽With the root mantra, there should be a hundred oblations with sacrificial sticks, ghee, cooked rice, sesame, fried grain, and jujube.

analyzed: mūlena śata homaḥ syāt astra homam atas na vā
translated: Or oblations with the weapon mantra.

analyzed: prāyaścittam tu aghoreṇa kṛtvā pūrṇā samanvitam
translated: The oblation performed with the purification by five fires accomplishes all purposes.🔽Having performed the atonement with the Aghora mantra along with the Purnas,

analyzed: sadyojātena saṃspṛśya gandhaṃmūlena dāpayet
translated: having touched with the Sadyojata mantra, one should offer scent with the root mantra.

analyzed: sa vatsa aṃgām suvarṇam cakāṃsya pātram su vastra yuj
translated: Along with a cow and calf, gold, a bell-metal vessel, and good cloth,

analyzed: tilam ājyam atha anyat vā dadyāt ācārya tṛptaye
translated: sesamum, ghee or anything else should be given for the satisfaction of the preceptor.

analyzed: jala dāna samopetam yātrā dānam idam matam
translated: This is considered as the gift of the journey along with the gift of water.

analyzed: atha anyat vā haridrān ca lavaṇan tila sarṣapau
translated: Then another thing, turmeric, salt, sesamum, mustard,

analyzed: tāmbūlam taṇḍulam ca eva gandha ājyam tila tailakam
translated: betel nut, rice, perfume, ghee, sesamum oil,

analyzed: śiva dānam iti khyātam kartuḥ iṣṭa pradāyakam
translated: is known as the gift of Shiva, which gives the desired things to the performer.

analyzed: yoginām dhyāna yuktānām śiva jñāna artha vedinām
translated: For yogis engaged in meditation, who know the meaning of Shiva's knowledge,

original: tatpūjādānamiṣṭaṃ syāt sarveṣāṃ prāṇināmapi // //🔽uṣṇīṣādyaṃ pradeyaṃ syādviśeṣeṣu dineṣu ca /🔽pratidānaṃ tu deyaṃ syājjalopetaṃ tu tadbhavet // //
analyzed: tat pūjā dānam iṣṭam syāt sarveṣām prāṇinām api  uṣṇīṣa ādyam pradeyam syāt viśeṣeṣu dineṣu ca  pratidānam tu deyam syāt jala upetam tu tat bhavet
translated: the worship and gift to them is desired for all living beings.🔽The turban and other things should be given on special days.🔽But the return gift should be given along with water.

analyzed: uṣṇīṣa ādyam pradātavyam dadyāt ācārya dhīmataḥ
translated: The turban and other things should be given to the wise preceptor.

analyzed: ācāryaḥ śivaḥ
translated: The preceptor is indeed Shiva himself, there is no difference between them.

analyzed: yaḥ paśyet anayoḥ bhedam saḥ dhogatim avāpnuyāt
translated: One who sees a difference between them would attain a downward course.

analyzed: sarva āgama jñam śāntam ca śiva liṃga arcana ratam  nitya homa ādibhiḥ yuktam śiva artha anna prakalpitam
translated: One who knows all scriptures, is peaceful, engaged in worshipping Shiva's Linga,🔽endowed with daily oblations etc., who has prepared food for Shiva's sake,

analyzed: graha bali ādi saṃyuktam bhikṣā pradam aninditam
translated: accompanied by the offering of strength to the planets, who is not censured in begging for alms,

analyzed: kim atra bahunā uktena deśikaḥ tu īdṛśaḥ yadā
translated: What is the use of speaking much in this matter? When the preceptor is of this kind,

analyzed: tṛptaḥ yatra puruṣa artha gatiḥ dvijāḥ
translated: where he is satisfied, there is the attainment of the human goal, O Brahmins.

original: satyaṃ satyaṃ punassatyaṃ trisatyaṃ satyameva hi /
analyzed: satyam satyam punar satyam tri satyam satyam eva hi
translated: Truth, truth, again truth, the threefold truth is indeed truth.

analyzed: tat vittam āhṛtam yena trijagat coraḥ ucyate
translated: He by whom that wealth is taken is called a thief of the three worlds.

analyzed: deva svāt apinistāryam kalpa koṭi śataiḥ api
translated: Even in hundreds of millions of kalpas, one cannot escape from the sin of stealing the property of gods.

original: tasmāt pāpaṃ parijñāya bahudhā deśikasya ca // //
analyzed: tasmāt pāpam parijñāya bahudhā deśikasya ca
translated: Therefore, having fully known the sin of the preceptor in various ways,

analyzed: tat dattam śraddhayā yatas
translated: that which is given by him with faith should be accepted, for it is the means of salvation.

analyzed: yātrā dānam idam kāryāt naivedya ādi nivedayet
translated: This offering etc. should be made, for this is the time for giving.

analyzed: pūrva ante bhavet liṃga pratiṣṭhā ādau ca sammatam
translated: In the beginning, it is approved in the installation of the linga etc.,

original: anyatrāpi ca kartavyaṃ rājñāṃ vijayahetave // //🔽sarvadānottamaṃ hyetat grahaṇādau viśiṣyate /
analyzed: anyatra api ca kartavyam rājñām vijaya hetave  sarva dāna uttamam hi etat grahaṇa ādau viśiṣyate
translated: and it should be done elsewhere also for the sake of the victory of kings.🔽This is the best of all gifts, it is especially excellent in the solar and lunar eclipses.

analyzed: sarva alaṃkāra saṃyuktam
translated: It should be endowed with all ornaments and with a face.

analyzed: śaiva ācārya samopetam āropya śibikā uttamam
translated: Having placed it on an excellent palanquin along with a Shaiva preceptor,

analyzed: pañca prākāra madhye vā tad bāhye vā pradakṣiṇam
translated: either in the middle of the five ramparts or outside them, circumambulating,

analyzed: kṛtvā yāna kramam proktam sarva maṃgala saṃyutam
translated: having performed the procession as described, accompanied by all auspicious things,

analyzed: rāja veṣa dharaiḥ puṃbhiḥ nānā nṛtta samanvitaiḥ
translated: With men dressed as kings, accompanied by various dances,

analyzed: ārūḍha śibikaiḥ dakṣaiḥ puṣpa udaiḥ gandha toyakaiḥ
translated: With skilled bearers of palanquins, with those offering flower garlands and fragrant water,

analyzed: agratas pṛṣṭhatas vā api kṛta sevā samanvitaiḥ
translated: Either in front or behind, accompanied by those who have rendered service,

analyzed: varjayet vā atha mukham rāja veṣa dhara anvitam
translated: Or one should avoid the face adorned with those dressed as kings.

analyzed: praveśya bhavanam paścāt sthāpayet pūrva vartmanā
translated: Having brought them into the palace, one should install them in the eastern path as before.

analyzed: kautukam ca parityajya gandha puṣpa ādibhiḥ yajet
translated: And having abandoned the auspicious thread, one should worship with fragrances, flowers, and so on.

analyzed: tad ante bera yātrā ādi tad pūrve vā prakīrtitam
translated: At the end of that, the procession of the idol and so on is declared to be before that.

analyzed: rātri ante ratham āropya devadevan naṭeśvaram
translated: At the end of the night, having placed the Lord of Dancers, the God of gods, on the chariot,

analyzed: pūrva yāna krameṇa eva grāma ādīnām
translated: In the same sequence as the eastern vehicle, to the right of the villages and so on,

analyzed: kṛtvā niveśayet antar punar snapanam ācaret
translated: Having done so, one should install it inside and perform the ablution again.

original: anyeṣvapi ca bereṣu vidhānaṃ sadṛśaṃ matam // //
analyzed: anyeṣu api ca bereṣu vidhānam sadṛśam matam
translated: The procedure is considered similar for other idols as well.

analyzed: tīrtha ahnaḥ pūrva divase tad pūrve vā dvijottamāḥ
translated: On the day before the holy bath, or before that, O best of Brahmins,

analyzed: yuddha ārambha kriyā upetam mṛga yātrā avasānakam  anyena ca utsava arthena bereṇa punar ācayet
translated: With the commencement of the battle ritual, ending with the hunting procession,🔽And again with another idol for the purpose of the festival, one should install it.

analyzed: viśeṣeṇa snapanam tasya vidheyam pūrva vartmanā
translated: In particular, its ablution should be performed in the same way as before.

analyzed: tad rātrau kautukam kuryāt tīrtha artham pūrva vartmanā
translated: On that night, he should perform the ritual for the sake of the sacred place, following the previous path.

analyzed: tīrtha artham sādhayet rātrau kalaśān nava saṃkhyayā
translated: For the sake of the sacred place, he should accomplish the night with nine water pots.

original: sasūtrān sāpidhānāṃśca sakūrcān pallavānvitān /🔽savastrānvā vivastrānvā pradhāne vastrameva vā // //
analyzed: sa sūtrān sa apidhānān ca sa kūrcān pallava anvitān  sa vastrān vā vivastrān vā pradhāne vastram eva vā
translated: With threads, with lids, with bunches of kuśa grass, with sprouts,🔽with clothes or without clothes, or the main cloth alone.

original: rātrau vā sādhayettīrthaṃ snāne tatsamayepi vā /
analyzed: rātrau vā sādhayet tīrtham snāne tad samaye api vā
translated: Either at night or at the time of bathing, he should accomplish the sacred place.

analyzed: prātar prāk udayāt samācaret
translated: In the morning, before sunrise, he should perform the rites for the sacred place.

analyzed: tīrtha sthānam ca saṃprāpya śuddhim kṛtvā mahī tale
translated: Having reached the place of the sacred place and having purified the ground,

analyzed: sthaṇḍila dvitayam kuryāt śūla artham kalaśa arthakam
translated: he should make two mounds for the trident and for the water pot.

analyzed: paścime sthāpayet śūlam tad agre kalaśān yaset
translated: In the west, he should install the trident, and in front of it, he should place the water pots.

analyzed: puṇyāham vācayitvā tu devān āhūya pūrvakam
translated: Having recited the auspicious verses, he should invoke the gods first.

analyzed: triśūle sarva tīrtham ca sarvam durgā samanvitam
translated: In the trident, he should collect all the sacred places along with all the Durga goddesses.

analyzed: madhye manonmanī yuktam gandha puṣpa ādibhiḥ yajet
translated: In the middle, he should worship it with scents, flowers, etc., along with Manonmani.

analyzed: tad jalaiḥ snāpayet śūlam nadī ādi antar praviśya ca
translated: With those waters, he should bathe the trident, having entered the river, etc.

analyzed: tīrtha saṃgrahaṇam kuryāt gaṃgā ādi āvāhanena ca
translated: He should collect the sacred places by invoking the Ganges and others.

original: he devi gaṃge yamune narmade ca sarasvati /
analyzed: he devi gaṃge yamune narmade ca sarasvati
translated: O Goddess Ganga, Yamuna, Narmada, and Saraswati,

analyzed: sindhoḥ gotāvari tvañca kāveḥ yatra jalāśaye
translated: O Sindhu, Godavari, and Kaveri, in this sacred water,

analyzed: sannidhībhava śarvasya tīrtha artham idam uttamam
translated: Be present for the sake of the pilgrimage, this is excellent.

analyzed: khera stamanam yāvat tīrthānām pāpa śuddhaye
translated: Until the sunset of Kheri, for the purification of sins of the holy places,

analyzed: tīrtha saṃgrahaṇam tad madhye prāc śirā anvitam
translated: The collection of holy places, with the head facing east,

original: triśūlaṃ snāpayedapsu śivamantramanusmaran // //🔽jalāduttīrya śūlantu jalatīre niveśayet /
analyzed: triśūlam snāpayet apsu śiva mantram anusmaran  jalāt uttīrya śūlam tu jala tīre niveśayet
translated: One should bathe the trident in water, remembering the mantra of Shiva.🔽Having emerged from the water, one should place the trident on the bank of the water.

original: tīrthasaṃgrahaṇaṃ kṛtvā tīrthaṃ devālayepi vā // //🔽avagāhanahīnantu nayeddūrajalāśaye /
analyzed: tīrtha saṃgrahaṇam kṛtvā tīrtham devālaye api vā  avagāhana hīnam tu nayet dūra jala āśaye
translated: Having collected the holy places, in the temple of the holy places,🔽Without immersion, one should take it to a distant water body.

analyzed: sarva alaṃkāra saṃyuktam praviśet ālayam prati
translated: Adorned with all ornaments, one should enter the temple.

analyzed: homan ca bali dānam ca kṛtvā prāc ukta vartmanā
translated: Having performed the homa and bali offerings according to the previously mentioned method,

analyzed: cūrṇa utsavam tatas kuryāt devasya āsthāna maṇṭape
translated: One should then perform the powder festival in the assembly hall of the god.

original: sthaṇḍile dvitayaṃ kuryāt devadevasya sannidhau /🔽triśūlaṃ paścimenyatrolūkhalaṃ viniveśayet // //
analyzed: sthaṇḍile dvitayam kuryāt devadevasya sannidhau  triśūlam
translated: On the sacrificial ground, two should be made in the presence of the god of gods.🔽The trident should be placed to the west, and the mortar should be placed here.

analyzed: tad madhye vinyaset rātrimatha tad cūrṇa siddhaye
translated: In the middle of that, one should place the night, and then the powder should be prepared for that.

analyzed: vastrāṇi āveṣṭya tad madhye vā kṣipet
translated: Having wrapped the cloth, one should place the night powder in between.

analyzed: triśūlam pūjayitvā ādau tatas rātri adhivāsanam  prakalpayet
translated: Having first worshipped the trident, then the night consecration.🔽Having resolved, one should arrange the power in the mortar called the base.

analyzed: musale pūjayitvā īśam kuryāt ghṛtaśiraḥ arpaṇam
translated: Having worshipped Ishvara in the pestle, one should perform the anointing with ghee.

analyzed: dūrvā puṣpa samopetaiḥ vrīhi taṇḍulaka ādibhiḥ
translated: With durva grass, flowers, and rice grains, etc.

original: sammukhaṃ vimukhaṃ vāpi śūlaṃ devasya kīrtitam /
analyzed: sammukham vimukham vā api śūlam devasya kīrtitam
translated: The trident of the deity is said to be either facing or turned away.

analyzed: tadvat musalam uddiṣṭam tathā eva ulūkhanam bhavet
translated: The pestle is also designated in the same way, and so should the mortar be.

original: savastraṃ vā vivastraṃ vā mūsalaṃ parikīrtitam /
analyzed: sa vastram vā vivastram vā mūsalam parikīrtitam
translated: The pestle is said to be either with or without cloth.

analyzed: musalam pūrvam abhyarcya ulūkhanam tad anantaram
translated: Having first worshipped the pestle, then the mortar.

analyzed: śiva tatva āditaḥ vā syāt ātma tatva āditaḥ api vā
translated: It may be from the principle of Shiva, or from the principle of the self, etc.

analyzed: dūrvā pradānam kartavyam guruṇā vā niyoginā
translated: The gift of durva grass should be made by the guru or the officiating priest.

analyzed: rājñā devyā ca tasya atha tad niyuktaiḥ mahātmabhiḥ
translated: Then by the king, the queen, and the great souls appointed by him,

analyzed: purohita mukhaiḥ deyam tatas māheśvaraiḥ janaiḥ
translated: it should be given by the priests and others, and then by the devotees of Mahesha.

analyzed: mad kanyābhiḥ ca dāsībhiḥ kartavyam rāja sannidhau
translated: By my daughters and female servants, it should be done in the presence of the king.

original: no cetrājaniyuktābhirudrakanyābhireva vā // //🔽dāsībhirvārtha bhaktairvā yogyairranyaiḥ krameṇa ca /
analyzed: no ced rājani yuktābhiḥ udra kanyābhiḥ eva vā  dāsībhiḥ vā artha bhaktaiḥ vā krameṇa ca
translated: Or by maidservants, or by other suitable persons, in order.

analyzed: dūrvā dānam prakartavyam viddhaiḥ deśika ājñayā
translated: The offering of Dūrvā grass should be made by the priest's disciples, as instructed by the preceptor.

analyzed: anyasmin api devasya devyāḥ vā kautuka antare
translated: In another festival of the Lord or the Goddess,

analyzed: tat ādau snāna kāla ādau kartavyam maṃgala arthakam
translated: at the beginning of that, at the time of bathing, etc., it should be done for the sake of auspiciousness.

analyzed: tad ante cūrṇayet rātrim tris kṛtvā ca astram uccaran
translated: At the end of that, one should grind the night three times, reciting the weapon mantra.

analyzed: dūrvā dānam krameṇa eva cūrṇayet rātrim ādarāt
translated: One should grind the night in order, with respect, with the Dūrvā grass.

analyzed: tat cūrṇam tat manum smṛtvā tasmāt ādāya nikṣipet
translated: Remembering that mantra, one should take that powder and place it

analyzed: nānāvidheṣu pātreṣu liṃga arthakam pratimā arthakam
translated: in various vessels, for the sake of the Liṅga, for the sake of the image.

original: utsavapratimārthakañca triśūlārthaṃ viśeṣataḥ /🔽parivārārthamekañca bhāgaṃ saṃkalpayet kramāt // //
analyzed: utsava pratimā arthakam ca triśūla artham viśeṣataḥ  parivāra artham ekaṃ ca bhāgam saṃkalpayet kramāt
translated: For the sake of the festival image, and especially for the trident,🔽one should set aside one part in order for the sake of the attendants.

analyzed: avaśiṣṭa jana artham ca saṃgrahet kalaśa ādiṣu
translated: And one should collect the remaining for the sake of the general public in pots, etc.

original: kevalaṃ gandhatailaṃ vā pṛthak pātreṣu kalpayet // //
analyzed: kevalam gandhatailam vā pṛthak pātreṣu kalpayet
translated: One should separately prepare only fragrant oil in separate vessels.

analyzed: saṃprokṣya hetinā paścāt hṛṇmantreṇa samarcayet  /
translated: Having sprinkled with the weapon mantra, one should then worship with the Hṛd mantra.

analyzed: amṛtīkṛtya gostanyā dadyāt tāmbūla pūrvakam
translated: After making it immortal with the milk of a cow, it should be offered along with betel leaves.

original: rātricūrṇaṃ ca deyaṃ syāt prāguktavidhinā dvijāḥ // / //
analyzed: rātri cūrṇam ca deyam syāt prāk ukta vidhinā dvijāḥ
translated: The powder mentioned earlier should be given according to the prescribed method, O Brahmins.

analyzed: cūrṇa utsavam triśūlena grāma ādau ālaye pi ca
translated: The powder festival should be performed with the trident in the village or even in the house.

analyzed: kārayet śīghra gatyā tu samarthaiḥ paricārakaiḥ
translated: It should be done quickly by capable attendants.

analyzed: mahā tīrtham prakartavyam samudra ādau mahā jale
translated: The great pilgrimage should be performed in the great water like the ocean.

original: nālpodake vidhātavyaṃ tacca kautukatīrthavat // / //🔽kiṃ tu berasamopetaṃ prapādi parimaṇḍite /
analyzed: na alpa udake vidhātavyam tat ca kautukatīrtha vat  kim tu bera samopetam prapādi parimaṇḍite
translated: It should not be done in small water, and that should be like the pilgrimage of Kautuka.🔽But it should be accompanied by the idol, surrounded by the procession,

analyzed: kalaśa sthāpana upetam devatā āhvāna saṃyutam
translated: accompanied by the installation of the water pot, and the invocation of the deity.

analyzed: viberam vā api prakartavyam tīrtha kārye dvijottamāḥ
translated: Or it should be performed without the idol in the pilgrimage work, O best of Brahmins.

original: tīrthasaṃgrahaṇaṃ pūrvaṃ na kṛte tu jalāntare // / //
analyzed: tīrtha saṃgrahaṇam pūrvam na kṛte tu jala antare
translated: If the collection of the pilgrimage has not been done earlier in the water,

analyzed: tīrtha saṃgrahaṇam kṛtvā mahā tīrtham samācaret
translated: after collecting the pilgrimage, the great pilgrimage should be performed.

original: vimocya kautukaṃ sarvaṃ bhaktebhyo viniveśya ca // / //🔽mahātīrthaṃ prakartavyaṃ śūlaberasamanvitam /
analyzed: vimocya kautukam sarvam bhaktebhyaḥ viniveśya ca  mahā tīrtham prakartavyam śūlabera samanvitam
translated: After releasing all the decorations and distributing them to the devotees,🔽the great pilgrimage should be performed along with the trident and the idol.

analyzed: triśūla sahitam vā api nānā devālaya āgataiḥ
translated: Or it should be performed along with the trident by those who have come from various temples.

analyzed: triśūlaiḥ devatā upetaiḥ sahitam vā samācaret
translated: Or one may perform it along with the deities holding tridents.

original: athavā padmacakrābhyāṃ sahitaṃ vā samācaret // / //🔽mahāmoṭisamāyuktaṃ rātrau vā tīrthamāśrayet /
analyzed: athavā padma cakrābhyām sahitam vā samācaret  mahā moṭi samāyuktam rātrau vā tīrtham āśrayet
translated: Or one may perform it along with the lotus and the discus.🔽One should resort to the holy place at night along with the great Motī (i.e. the great lunar eclipse).

analyzed: ahnitīrtham prakartavyam madhyāhne tīrtham uttamam
translated: The holy place should be performed in the morning, the midday holy place is excellent.

analyzed: pūrvāhne madhyamam tīrtham aparāhnedhamam bhavet
translated: The morning holy place is middling, the afternoon holy place would be inferior.

original: hitvendu grahaṇaṃ tīrthaṃ rātrau vā varamiṣyete // / //
analyzed: hitvā indu grahaṇam tīrtham rātrau vā varam iṣyete
translated: Leaving the lunar eclipse, the holy place is desired to be excellent at night.

analyzed: tat ca moṭi samāyuktam uttamottamam iṣyate
translated: And that along with Motī is desired to be the most excellent of the excellent.

analyzed: tithi pradhānam sāmudrayam anyat dakṣa pradhānakam
translated: The Samudra Yamas are based on the lunar day, the others are based on Dakṣa.

analyzed: tithi nakṣatra saṃyoga yuktam durlabham ucyate
translated: The conjunction of the lunar day and the lunar mansion is said to be difficult to obtain.

analyzed: pūrvāhne vā tithi ṛkṣa samanvitam
translated: In the morning or afternoon, endowed with the lunar day and the lunar mansion,

original: samudre vātha nadyādau kāryaṃ madhyandine varam /
analyzed: samudre vā atha nadī ādau kāryam madhyandine varam
translated: in the ocean or in a river etc., the midday is the best.

analyzed: nakṣatram adhikam tu ahni saṃgrāhyam tithiḥ eva vā
translated: The lunar mansion is superior to the day, or the lunar day itself should be taken.

analyzed: vāra dvaya gate ṛkṣe tithau vā yoga sambhave
translated: When the lunar mansion or the lunar day occurs on two days, and there is a Yoga (i.e. conjunction of the sun with a lunar mansion),

analyzed: tīrtha ṛkṣa dvaya saṃprāptau eka māse param varam
translated: the attainment of two lunar mansions in one month is the best.

analyzed: tatra api yoga yuktam ced pūrvam saṃgrāhyam eva vā
translated: Even there, if one is engaged in yoga, the previous one should be taken up first.

original: yasmin māse tu yadṛkṣaṃ pūrvaṃ tīrthamanuṣṭhitam // / //
analyzed: yasmin māse tu yadṛkṣam pūrvam tīrtham anuṣṭhitam
translated: In which month and which lunar mansion the pilgrimage was performed earlier,

original: tasmin māse tu tadṛkṣe paścādapi samācaret /
analyzed: tasmin māse tu tat ṛkṣe paścāt api samācaret
translated: in that month and in that lunar mansion, one should perform it later also.

original: liṃge svāyambhuve cettu daivike cārṣikepi vā // / //🔽mānuṣe pūrvatīrthakṣe māsarkṣantadvimāsake /
analyzed: liṃge svāyambhuve ced tu daivike ca ārṣike api vā  mānuṣe pūrva tīrtha kṣe
translated: If it is in a self-existent linga, or in a divine one, or in an ṛṣiliṅga,🔽in a human one, the lunar mansion of the previous month should be used, or in the second month,

original: nakṣatre vā tithau vāpi tīrthakāryaṃ dvijottamāḥ // / //
analyzed: nakṣatre vā tithau vā api tīrtha kāryam dvijottamāḥ
translated: in the lunar mansion or on the lunar day, the rite of pilgrimage should be performed, O best of Brahmins.

analyzed: jala madhye tatas tīrtham kārayet deśika uttamaḥ
translated: Then the best preceptor should perform the pilgrimage in the middle of the water.

analyzed: dvidhā avagāhanam proktam bera yoga viyogataḥ
translated: Two kinds of ablution are mentioned - with the idol and without the idol.

analyzed: viyoge tīra deśe tu bera snapanam eva vā
translated: In the absence of the idol, on the bank, or the bathing of the idol,

analyzed: kārayet pūjayet paścāt gandha ādyaiḥ upacārakaiḥ
translated: one should perform it and then worship with scents etc. and services.

analyzed: naivedyam dāpayet tatra no ced devālaye pi vā
translated: One should offer food there, or if not, in the temple,

analyzed: ārāma ādau ca deveśam toṣayet sarva maṃgalaiḥ
translated: and in the garden etc., one should please the Lord of gods with all auspicious things.

analyzed: grāma pradakṣiṇa upetam athavā tat vivarjayet
translated: Or one may do it with the circumambulation of the village, or without it.

analyzed: sarveḥ bhakta jana upetam taiḥ vihīnam tu vā bhavet
translated: It may be accompanied by all devotees, or without them.

analyzed: pūrṇāhutim tatas hutvā sarva maṃgala saṃyutam
translated: Then, having offered the final oblation, accompanied by all auspicious things,

analyzed: dhāma pradakṣiṇa upetam viśuddhaiḥ paricārakaiḥ
translated: together with circumambulation of the temple by the pure attendants,

analyzed: grāhayitvā tu deveśam devyā vidyeśvaraiḥ yutam
translated: having made the Lord of gods, accompanied by the Goddess and the Lords of knowledge, enter,

analyzed: garbha gehe su saṃsthāpya liṃge pīṭhehi anukramāt
translated: having well-established in the sanctum, in the liṅga and the pedestal respectively,

analyzed: devam devīn ca vinyasya vidyeśān paritas nyaset
translated: having placed the god and the goddess, one should assign the Lords of knowledge around.

analyzed: tat tat toyaiḥ ca saṃprokṣya śuddha udaiḥ snāpayet vibhum  tatas saṃpūjayet devam yathā vibhava vistaram
translated: Having sprinkled with the respective waters, one should bathe the Lord with pure water.🔽Then one should worship the Lord according to one's affluence and extent.

analyzed: dhvaja avarohaṇam tasyām rātrau śreṣṭham udāhṛtam
translated: The descent of the flag on that night is declared to be the best.

original: tṛtīye pañcame vāpi saptame navameva vā /
analyzed: tṛtīye pañcame vā api saptame navame eva vā
translated: On the third, fifth, seventh, or ninth day,

analyzed: ekādaśa ahe viśva ṛkṣe kuryāt pañcadaśa ahake  /
translated: on the eleventh day, on the full moon day,

analyzed: kuryāt saptadaśa ahe vā ekona viṃśati ahe api ca  /
translated: on the seventeenth day, or on the nineteenth day,

analyzed: mūrti homa yutam kuryāt diśā homam tat ūrdhvatas
translated: one should perform the Mūrti Homa and the Diśa Homa afterwards.

analyzed: dhvaja ādi tīrtha paryantam dina saṃkhyā sthitā yadi
translated: If the number of days is from the flag etc. up to the holy place,

analyzed: punar utsavam ārabhya tīrtha antam sarvam ācaret
translated: starting again from the festival, one should perform everything up to the holy place.

analyzed: dhvaja avaroha ṛkṣe tu śuddha ākhyam snapanam nayet  /
translated: In the case of the descent of the flag, one should perform the consecration called purification.

original: liṃge bere śūle dhvaje snapanamācaret /🔽arcanoktaṃ samabhyarcya malābhirdhāmabhūṣayet // //🔽garbhagehaṃ samārabhya gopurāntaṃ svaśaktitaḥ /
analyzed: liṃge bere śūle dhvaje snapanam ācaret  arcana uktam samabhyarcya malābhiḥ dhāma bhūṣayet  garbhageham samārabhya gopura antam sva śaktitaḥ
translated: One should perform the ablution in the liṅga, idol, trident, or flag.🔽Having worshipped as stated in the worship, one should adorn the temple with unguents.

analyzed: kālāgaru udbhavaiḥ dhūpaiḥ dhūpayet deva mandiram
translated: Starting from the inner sanctum up to the main gate, one should offer incense to the temple of the deity with incense made from saffron, according to one's ability.

original: naivedyaṃ vividhandadyāt toṣaye ddevaṃ mādarāt /🔽caṇḍapūjāntataḥ kuryāt homena sahitannavā // //
analyzed: naivedyam vividhan dadyāt toṣaye ddevam mā ādarāt
translated: One should offer various kinds of food and please the deity with devotion.🔽Then one should perform the worship of Caṇḍa along with the homa.

analyzed: tatas grāma balim dadyāt anna liṃga samanvitam
translated: Then one should offer the village oblation along with the food offering and liṅga.

analyzed: triśūlena samāyuktam vā
translated: Or along with the trident and Caṇḍanātha.

analyzed: bherikā mad dala upetam paṭahaiḥ kāhalaiḥ yutam
translated: Accompanied by bherī and maddala drums, along with paṭaha and kāhala drums,

analyzed: śrīkhaṇṭa śaṃkha saṃyuktam bali kāle tu ghoṣaṇam
translated: and accompanied by śrīkhaṇḍa and conch shells, one should proclaim at the time of the oblation.

original: kṛtvā visarjayeddevān brahmadīn grāmavartinaḥ /🔽dhvajevādau balindadyāttadante ca dhvajaṃ punaḥ // //
analyzed: kṛtvā visarjayet devān brahma dīn grāma vartinaḥ  dhvaja iva ādau balin dadyāt tad ante ca dhvajam punar
translated: Having dismissed the deities beginning with Brahmā who reside in the village,🔽one should offer the oblation first to the flag and then again to the flag at the end.

analyzed: avatārya paṭa stham ca yojayet vṛṣabham vṛṣe
translated: And having brought down the deity from the cloth, one should yoke it to the bull.

original: dhvajāvarohaṇasyādau cānte vā baliriṣyate // //🔽ācāryaṃ pūjayetkartā vastrahemāṃgulīyakaiḥ /
analyzed: dhvaja avarohaṇasya ādau ca ante vā baliḥ iṣyate  / ācāryam pūjayet kartā vastra hema aṃgulīyakaiḥ
translated: At the beginning or end of the descent of the flag, oblation is desired.🔽The performer should worship the preceptor with clothes, gold, and rings.

analyzed: aṃkura arpaṇa kāle ca dhvaja ārohaṇa kālake
translated: At the time of the offering of sprouts and the time of hoisting the flag,

analyzed: yāga adhivāsena homa prārambhe sandhyayoḥ dvayoḥ  athavā ca eka sandhyāyāḥ prārambha iva avasānake
translated: At the time of the consecration of the sacrifice, at the beginning of the homa, at both the sandhyas,🔽Or at the beginning or end of one sandhya,

analyzed: nṛtta mūrti utsave tīrthe śuddha snapana kālake
translated: At the festival of the dance form, at the time of the pure bathing in the sacred place,

analyzed: dakṣiṇān dāpayet paścāt trividhā sā ca sammatā
translated: Afterwards, the dakshina should be given, which is considered to be of three types.

original: adhamā pañcaniṣkā ca dviguṇā madhyamā bhavet /
analyzed: adhamā pañca niṣkā ca dviguṇā madhyamā bhavet
translated: The inferior one is of five nishkas, the medium one should be double that,

original: triguṇā cottamā jñeyā deśikasya tu dakṣiṇā // //
analyzed: triguṇā ca uttamā jñeyā deśikasya tu dakṣiṇā
translated: And the superior one should be known as triple the dakshina of the preceptor.

analyzed: tad ardha saṃkhyayā proktā dakṣiṇā kanyasa krame
translated: The dakshina in the inferior sequence is said to be half of that,

original: śreṣṭhaṃ tu dviguṇā proktā tvanyathā vā nigadyate // //
analyzed: śreṣṭham tu dviguṇā proktā tu anyathā vā nigadyate
translated: The superior one is said to be double, or otherwise it is stated.

original: niṣkamardhaṃ tadardhaṃ vā pratyahaṃ dakṣiṇā matā /
analyzed: niṣkam ardham tad ardham vā pratyaham dakṣiṇā matā
translated: The dakshina is considered to be half a nishka or half of that per day.

original: bhaktotsavantataḥ kuryāt pakṣāhāt pūrva eva vā // //
analyzed: bhakta utsava antatas kuryāt pakṣa ahāt pūrvaḥ eva vā
translated: Then the devotee's festival should be performed, or even before the day of the festival,

original: utsavādau ca madhye vā bhaktānāmutsavo mataḥ /
analyzed: utsava ādau ca madhye vā bhaktānām utsavaḥ mataḥ
translated: The festival of the devotees is considered to be at the beginning, in the middle, or at the end of the festival.

original: saṃvatsarodbhavekāle yadā māsotsavo bhavet // //🔽bali homādisaṃyukto berayātrādi saṃyutaḥ /
analyzed: saṃvatsara udbhave kāle yadā māsa utsavaḥ bhavet  bali homa ādi saṃyuktaḥ bera yātrā ādi saṃyutaḥ
translated: When the annual festival falls during the month,🔽it should be accompanied by offerings, oblations, and so on, and should include the procession of the idol.

analyzed: varjayet vā ānayet bera yātrā mātram atha api vā  māsa utsava dvaya prāptau evam eva samācaret
translated: One should either avoid the procession of the idol or just have the procession.🔽If both annual festivals occur, one should do the same.

analyzed: māsa utsavam iha proktaḥ tu eka aha utsava dvijāḥ  kuryāt ekam anekam vā māsi ekasmin tad utsavam
translated: O Brahmins, the monthly festival is said to be like the one-day festival here.🔽One should perform that festival either once or many times in a month.

analyzed: aṃkura arpaṇa pūrvam vā tad viyuktam atha ācaret  eka aham utsavam kuryāt bherī tāḍana pūrvakam
translated: One should perform the one-day festival preceded by the offering of sprouts, or without it.🔽One should perform the one-day festival preceded by the beating of the drum.

analyzed: sthaṇḍila dvitayam kṛtvā śūlam ekatra vinyaset
translated: Having made two altars, one should place the spear on one of them.

analyzed: tad agre sthāpayet bherīm puṇyāham vācayet tatas
translated: One should place the drum in front of it and then recite the auspicious benediction.

original: astraṃ bherīñca saṃpūjya bherīṃ santāḍayet kramāt // //🔽tataḥ pratisaraṃ baddhvā deve śūle yathākramam /
analyzed: astram bherīm ca saṃpūjya bherīm santāḍayet kramāt  tatas pratisaram baddhvā deve śūle yathākramam
translated: Having worshipped the weapon and the drum, one should beat the drum in order.🔽Then, having tied the protective thread, one should place the spear on the god in order.

analyzed: dhāma pradakṣiṇam kṛtvā yāga śālām praviśya ca
translated: Having circumambulated the temple and entered the sacrificial hall,

original: sthaṇḍile sthāpayet śūlaṃ vedyūrdhve sthaṇḍile śubhe /
analyzed: sthaṇḍile sthāpayet śūlam vedi ūrdhve sthaṇḍile śubhe
translated: one should place the spear on the altar, on the auspicious altar above the sacrificial platform.

analyzed: vinyaset śiva kumbham ca vardhanī sahitam guruḥ
translated: The preceptor should install the Shiva-pot along with the Vardhani.

original: samantāt sthāpayedaṣṭau ghaṭānvākalaśānvatha /🔽puṇyāhaṃ vācayitvā tu prokṣayedastravāriṇā // //
analyzed: samantāt sthāpayet aṣṭau ghaṭān vā ākalaśān vatha  puṇyāham vācayitvā tu prokṣayet astra vāriṇā
translated: All around, he should place eight pots or water-jars.🔽Having recited the Punyashastra, he should sprinkle with the weapon water.

analyzed: hema abjam nikṣipet kumbhe vardhanyām vastra veṣṭitam
translated: He should place the golden lotus in the pot, wrapped in cloth, in the Vardhani.

analyzed: ubhayam ca vidhātavyam sūtra kūrca pidhāna yuj
translated: Both should be made with a thread, a bunch of darbha grass, and a cover.

analyzed: phala pallava saṃyuktam kumbhe śambhummanā unmanīm
translated: In the pot, he should worship Shambhu along with Manonmani, along with fruits and sprouts.

analyzed: vardhanyām aṣṭa vidyeśān kalaśeṣu samarcayet
translated: In the Vardhani, he should worship the eight Vidyeshvara, and in the water-jars, he should worship the eight Vasus.

analyzed: dvārāṇi dvārapān nandi pramukhān kalaśeṣu vā
translated: He should worship the doors, the door-keepers, Nandi and others, in the water-jars.

analyzed: sthaṇḍila etān samabhyarcya toraṇaiḥ aṣṭa maṃgalaiḥ  saṃyuktam tad vihīnam vā daśa āyudha yutat navā
translated: Having worshipped them on the sacrificial ground, along with the eight auspicious arches,

analyzed: kuṇḍe vā sthaṇḍile vā api homa karma samācaret
translated: either with or without, along with the ten weapons, he should perform the fire sacrifice either in the sacrificial pit or on the sacrificial ground.

analyzed: pañca saṃkhye thavā ekasmin pūrva dravya samanvitam
translated: In five or one, along with the previous substances,

original: tato grāmabaliṃ dadyāt bimbena sahitantu vā // //
analyzed: tatas grāma balim dadyāt bimbena vā
translated: then he should offer the village oblation, either along with the image or not.

analyzed: evam rātrau prakartavyam prātaryāga īśvarān yajet
translated: Thus it should be done at night, and in the morning he should worship the lords of the sacrifice.

original: kṛtvā homaṃ baliṃ kuryādbereṇa ca samanvitam // //
analyzed: kṛtvā homam balim kuryāt bereṇa ca samanvitam
translated: Having performed the homa, he should offer oblations along with the idol.

analyzed: ālayam praviśya ante kuryāt cūrṇa utsavam guruḥ
translated: The preceptor should enter the sanctum and perform the Utsarga (concluding rite) with the idol.

original: tatastīrthaṃ prakartavyamatrānuktantu pūrvavat // //🔽prātarvākārayet sarvaṃ bherītāḍana varjitam /
analyzed: tatas tīrtham prakartavyam atra anuktam tu pūrvavat  prātar vā kārayet sarvam bherī tāḍana varjitam
translated: Then the Tīrtha (consecration of the idol) should be performed. What is not mentioned here should be done as before.🔽In the morning, everything should be done without the beating of drums.

original: sadyodhivāsanaṃ kṛtvā prāgvatsarvaṃ samācaret // //🔽cūrṇotsavavihīnaṃ vā vidhānamidamācaret /
analyzed: sadyas adhivāsanam kṛtvā prāgvat sarvam samācaret  cūrṇa utsava vihīnam vā vidhānam idam ācaret
translated: Having performed the Sadyah-Dhivasana (instant consecration), everything should be done as before.🔽Or this procedure should be followed without the Utsarga (concluding rite).

original: ālaye baliyāne ca syātāṃ tīrthaṃ vihāya vā // //🔽berayātrā prakartavyā sāyāhne vā pradoṣake /
analyzed: ālaye bali yāne ca syātām tīrtham vihāya vā  bera yātrā prakartavyā sāyāhne vā pradoṣake
translated: In the sanctum and the vehicle, the Tīrtha (consecration of the idol) may or may not be performed.🔽The idol should be taken out in procession in the evening or at dusk.

original: tīrthordhvañcet bhavet yātrā balikāle'nyaberataḥ // //🔽berayātrā vidheyā vā tvanyathā ca nigadyate /
analyzed: tīrtha ūrdhvam ced bhavet yātrā  bera yātrā vidheyā vā tu anyathā ca nigadyate
translated: If the procession is to be held after the Tīrtha (consecration of the idol), it should be done at the time of offering oblations with another idol.🔽Or the idol should be taken out in procession. Otherwise, it is said:

analyzed: bali homa ādikam hitvā bhramaṇam kevalantu vā
translated: Excepting the offering of oblations and other rites, only the circumambulation should be done.

original: devasya kautukaṃ kuryāddineṣvetadapīritam // / //🔽karturvāñchāvaśāt kḷptakāleṣvetacca vā matam /
analyzed: devasya kautukam kuryāt dineṣu etat api īritam  kartuḥ vāñchā vaśāt kḷpta kāleṣu etat ca vā matam
translated: The auspicious thread of the deity should be performed on these days.🔽Or it is considered to be done on the days fixed according to the desire of the performer.

analyzed: kartṛ janma avasāna ṛkṣe ca ārdrā nakṣatre eva vā
translated: Or on the lunar day ending with the birth star of the performer, or on the lunar day of the constellation Ārdrā.

analyzed: caturdaśyām atha aṣṭamyām parvaṇi ubhaya pakṣayoḥ
translated: On the fourteenth and eighth days, and on the full and new moon days,

analyzed: ayane viṣuve rāhu darśana idam ana utsave
translated: On the fourteenth and eighth days of both fortnights, at the solstices, equinoctial points, and eclipses, during the festive viewing of Rahu,

analyzed: saṃvatsara ādi lekhāyāt nava toya āgatau api
translated: In the sacred month worship, in the lighting of lamps on the Kṛttikā constellation,🔽In the writing of the annual account, in the arrival of new water,
In the Pūrvā Phālguni constellation, in the offering of new food,

analyzed: anyasmin maṃgale kārye kuryāt eka utsavam budhaḥ

analyzed: jagat kṣobha vināśa artham bādhāyena graheṇa ca
